responses: Hello! I am the NWU Intelligent Chatbot. How can I assist you today?
Hi there! How can I help you with your NWU enquiries?
Greetings! Feel free to ask me anything about NWU admissions, fees, or campus life.

patterns: How much is the school fees?
I want to know the breakdown of fees
How much is fees for Computer Science?
Are there different fees for non-indigenes?
responses: The school fees for NWU varies by faculty. For Computer Science, it is N55,000 for Indigenes. Non-indigenes pay a slightly higher rate as specified in the university handbook.
You can generate your payment invoice via the student portal. Acceptance fee is also required for new students.
School fees payment is mandatory before course registration. Please check the portal for your specific breakdown.

patterns: What is the cut-off mark for 2024?
How do I apply for Direct Entry?
responses: Admission requirements include a minimum UTME score (usually 160-180+ depending on the course) and 5 O'Level credits including English and Math.
Screening dates for the 2024/2025 session will be announced on the university website and notice boards. Please stay updated.
For Direct Entry, you need a minimum of Lower Credit in your Diploma or equivalent qualification.

patterns: How do I apply for hostel?
responses: Hostel allocation is done via the student portal on a first-come, first-served basis, with priority given to freshers and final-year students.
The hostel fee is separate from the tuition fee. You must complete your school fees payment before applying for accommodation.

patterns: Is the portal open for registration?
responses: The academic calendar is usually available on the university website. Resumption for the new session is typically announced after the Senate meeting.
The portal is currently open for course registration for all levels. Please ensure you register before the deadline to avoid penalties.

patterns: I can't login to my portal
responses: To reset your portal password, please visit the ICT Center at the Senate building with your admission letter or ID card.
If you are a fresher, your default password is usually found in your admission letter. If you changed it and forgot, visit the ICT helpdesk.
You're welcome! Feel free to return if you have more questions.
Goodbye! Have a productive academic day.
Glad I could help. Visit again soon!
